body:
concept ACK
there are 2 subtests and only one requires wallet, this PR enables the other one to run even with disabled wallet.
although instead of splitting can add an if condition (using self.is_wallet_compiled()) in runtests.

- Makes sense to split in two file. There are 2 subtests and only one requires wallet as @Shubhankar-Gambhir sayd.

- `self.skip_if_no_wallet()` calls to [self.is_wallet_compiled()](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/test/functional/test_framework/test_framework.py#L817). Inside bitcoin functional tests, `self.skip_if_no_wallet()` is mainly used (77 times) and self.is_wallet_compiled() (16 times). I think that `self.is_wallet_compiled()` is used for some special cases and this one is not one of them. So, `self.skip_if_no_wallet()` is better.

- ACK ([90e382b5123ae97dc8f536e847ca790e21467446](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22794/commits/90e382b5123ae97dc8f536e847ca790e21467446))

- Tests I have done:

   - Run tests on compiled bitcoin with PR changes and wallet:
   ```sh
   $ test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
   2021-08-27T19:39:18.334000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_q38ex0pf
   2021-08-27T19:39:18.648000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
   2021-08-27T19:39:18.803000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_q38ex0pf on exit
   2021-08-27T19:39:18.803000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful

   $ test/functional/wallet_invalid_address_message.py
   2021-08-27T19:40:12.106000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_f3rhiwtn
   2021-08-27T19:40:12.563000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
  2021-08-27T19:40:12.669000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_f3rhiwtn on exit
  2021-08-27T19:40:12.669000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful
   ```
   - Run tests on compiled bitcoin with PR changes but without wallet (--disable-wallet):
   ```sh
   $ test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
   2021-08-27T19:34:27.769000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_ahdk12up
   2021-08-27T19:34:28.115000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
   2021-08-27T19:34:28.271000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_ahdk12up on exit
   2021-08-27T19:34:28.271000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful

   $ test/functional/wallet_invalid_address_message.py
   2021-08-27T19:34:38.719000Z TestFramework (WARNING): Test Skipped: wallet has not been compiled.
   2021-08-27T19:34:38.769000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
   2021-08-27T19:34:38.769000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_2hs3yym1 on exit
   2021-08-27T19:34:38.769000Z TestFramework (INFO): Test skipped
   ```
   - Run tests on compiled bitcoin from master without wallet (--disable-wallet):
   ```sh
   $ test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
   2021-08-28T23:38:12.242000Z TestFramework (WARNING): Test Skipped: wallet has not been compiled.
   2021-08-28T23:38:12.294000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
   2021-08-28T23:38:12.294000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_mif2y1xy on exit
   2021-08-28T23:38:12.294000Z TestFramework (INFO): Test skipped

   $ test/functional/wallet_invalid_address_message.py
   bash: test/functional/wallet_invalid_address_message.py: File or folder does not exist
  ```
Instead of removing this, I think a test should added instead?

body:
Just in case i was not clear earlier the below patch would achieve the same 
<details>
<summary>patch</summary>

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py b/test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
index e362642f0..6b92b2fe1 100755
--- a/test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
+++ b/test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
@@ -29,9 +29,6 @@ class InvalidAddressErrorMessageTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
         self.num_nodes = 1
 
-    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
-        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
-
     def test_validateaddress(self):
         node = self.nodes[0]
 
@@ -87,7 +84,10 @@ class InvalidAddressErrorMessageTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
 
     def run_test(self):
         self.test_validateaddress()
-        self.test_getaddressinfo()
+
+        # skip if wallet is disabled
+        if self.is_wallet_compiled():
+            self.test_getaddressinfo()
 
 
 if __name__ == '__main__':
```
</details>

body:
The test has been changed to use `is_wallet_compiled` and `init_wallet`.

Also added test for `BECH32_INVALID_VERSION` case.

Approach ACK
test was succesful when run on bitcoin-core compiled without wallet (--disable-wallet):
```
2021-09-20T19:30:10.881000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_bha1iotz
2021-09-20T19:30:26.999000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
2021-09-20T19:30:33.380000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_bha1iotz on exit
2021-09-20T19:30:33.380000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful
```
nit: I don't think the comment is needed, when the code is self-explanatory
diff_hunk:

     def run_test(self):
         self.test_validateaddress()
-        self.test_getaddressinfo()
+
+        # skip if wallet is disabled

body: Out of curiosity, how did you notice the non-wallet-rpc test is skipped when wallet is not enabled (before your PR)? Thanks @lsilva01.

unrelated to this change, but it might be nice for `init_wallet()` to be defined as

```diff
-    def init_wallet(self, i):
+    def init_wallet(self, *, node):
```
so the calls become `self.init_wallet(node=0)`

use of splat optional, to be decided.

For now there is only a handful of calls to update.
diff_hunk:
@@ -87,7 +84,11 @@ def test_getaddressinfo(self):
 
     def run_test(self):
         self.test_validateaddress()
-        self.test_getaddressinfo()
+
+        # skip if wallet is disabled
+        if self.is_wallet_compiled():
+            self.init_wallet(0)
